title: Taric Redesign
body: Taric is outdated and a bit dead as a champion maybe a redesign would help :D

Sure he can still have his joke about outrageous gems and whatnot, but it should just be a joke. It shouldn't be what defines him as a character. In his current lore it says he's a kind man who values protecting people and healing them. What most people see these days (no thanks to various memes) is a creepy stalker guy who says the word outrageous a lot and has a fetish for Gems. He could be sooooooooooooooooo much more though.

Agreed. The more generic badasses there are the less coll they are. 

Why change the unique aspects of the character.

In general, Taric is really one dimensional right now.  He's just the same joke over and over.  He's supposed to be about protecting people and compassion.  But we don't see that in his lore or his dialogue.  Yes, he can have a few jokes, yes he can have some over the top aspects to him (hell, Braum is very over the top, but done right).  What you should look for in Taric, is honor, prudence, valor, determination, and a strong compassion.  Build him up on those aspects, and you'll build his character.  His gem fetish (cause that's what it is right now to the community) is a joke, not a humanizing quality.  He's supposed to draw power and magic from them, not be fixated on them.

So, let Taric be quirky, knightly, and proud.  If you make him funny, that's fine.  But give him a reason to be funny.  If you want him to be effeminate, outrageous, and flashy... then you're missing out on who you already have.  Don't make him into a Yumichika or Charlotte Chuhlhourne from Bleach, make him into Dordoni Alessandro Del Socaccio.  Make him a proud warrior with an appreciation for beauty.

But yes, you can have his taunt be "You are simply, outrageous!"

While this is cool and would probably make for a pretty good Taric rework, I don't want to see him remade into this.

Why?

Because he reminds me of the old League of Legends. Where champions blended serious themes and abilities with just the slightest brush of silliness and absurdity. You can still see this in old champions who haven't been revamped (Shaco, Alistar, Corki, Teemo), where they come across as heroic or powerful most of the times, but what also shines through are the little quirks in their personalities that make them uniquely unique.

Taric has this quality right now. He's heavily grounded in a paladin archetype, with his armor, shield, willingness to protect allies, and of course being SaF (Suave as Fruitloops). But that's not who Taric *is*, he has this grand over the top flamboyantly badass quality to him that really defines him as being Taric. 

Any rework that attempts to update Taric should keep this in mind, Taric has a legacy and that's about all he has left now, so don't take that away, pretty please.

EDIT: I realized I was a bit vague on how this connected with the image OP put up. Don't get me wrong, it's wonderful artwork, and if this was used as inspiration to update Taric, that'd be wonderful. The style of the artwork gives off the impression though that he's far too serious, which is something Taric should never be.

I think with a little more "Outrageousness", it could turn into something fantastic. Bring in a little more color, bigger gems, and better (Outrageous) hair, and he can get more of what we are looking for.

My problem with Taric is that I don't actually know what his character is supposed to *be*. He's a "Gem Knight," whatever the hell that is. So do his *gems* allow him to heal people? Are they magic? What kind of magic do they perform and why are they useful for him? Do *they* let him stun people? What is his W about? Is that ice or... gems? 

Taric just has no definite character or fleshed-out central idea to him. He's completely devoid of identity outside of being a walking joke. His kit is just *stuff*. A heal, a stun, an armor buff that can do AoE damage, and an unexciting ult that gives a power aura. If you put that next to, say, Sona or Thresh, you begin to see just how flat and lifeless Taric really is. 

When I think of Taric, I don't think of a paladin (paladins are holy men, and Taric's heal is just generic green, and nothing else about him screams "holy"), and I don't even think of a compassionate or selfless knight. I think of gems, because that is his entire identity. I'd like to see him taken in any direction because he currently doesn't seem to have one.

I couldn't agree more.  Riot continually calls Taric a paladin, but he's thematically not a paladin.  He's a weird magic knight with a gem focus.  His kit could feel so much more fitting, if the abilities were animated differently.  Make his stun be him raising his shield and stunning with a flash of light, not a weird green ball.

If he's supposed to be a paladin, show it.  If he's not supposed to be a paladin, then show us what a Gem Knight is!

I might be a minority here, but A) I like serious takes on things (though not over the top grimdark), and B) as a bi dude I am so tired of the gay jokes. Because it's like a double slap: we don't get any confirmation that he is, in fact LGBT (which means no representation) and he's also made a laughingstock because of his flamboyant design. And even if he was gay or bi or whatever, the flamboyance just plays into the stereotype. Making him more serious would either get us an anti-stereotype if he's ever confirmed gay/bi, and/or would at least curb the gay jokes somewhat.

I'm sure most straight people here are gonna jump at me for this, but that's kinda easy when it's not a part of you that's being relentlessly mocked every time a champion is picked. I like Taric, he was one of my first champs, and I'd love to see him brought back to relevance in a cool way.

The base Taric is just off enough that it feels weird.

He should be very pretty, he should be impeccably groomed, he should have a smooth and rich voice, and he should be appreciative of similar qualities in others. Heck, I wouldn't mind him being somewhat flirtatious, even.

However, he shouldn't be just a joke, the way he is now. He needs to have room for humor, since many of his quirks are a rather pleasant contrast to other more somber champions, but that doesn't mean he should be without his own badassery. I think a lot of people want to play a true paladin character without feeling like they're just the butt of every joke. I mean, the whole "Ooh, Taric/Ez in bot lane brush, how scaaAAAaaAAAndalous~*~" joke is just tired at this point.

Give us a heroic and badass paladin, but let him be pretty and flirtatious when he's not dismantling his enemies and rallying his allies. Give us a gem-encrusted hammer of face-destruction, but let its wielder also enjoy gems for their beauty.

I have to agree with this statement. It's a very tricky argument to make with Taric from a personal sense: people either love the fact that he's a joke character or hate it, and it's certainly going to be a challenge to really try and please both crowds.

Despite my empathy for preserving as much of the old league as we can, however, I have to side with giving Taric at least a *little* of a personality upgrade. Let's ask some honest questions here. How many League players in general, for instance, know Taric says this:

*"Malphite, never bring a rock to a gem fight."*

I'm gonna be honest; I myself didn't know he had a special Malphite taunt until I just looked it up on the wiki, and I used to main Taric as a support. Now, how many League players in general know that Taric says *this*:

*"Gems? Gems are truly outrageous. They are truly, truly, truly outrageous."*

Honestly, I do believe that at least some of Taric's slightly flamboyant flair should remain in tact. It's part of his personality, one of the only things that keeps him unique in League right now, IMO. However, it's probably time to shore up some of the excess. Honestly, unless he gets some sort of in-depth lore and mechanics remake, he will continue to be the butt of the internet's jokes and will fade into obscurity like Urgot and Poppy seem to have done.

Also, for those who might be interested, please check out my champion concept: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/BxIn84WU-champion-concept-valruk-the-jungles-revenge

A lot of people are talking about how they want a silly Taric over a serious one, and how Taric is silly now and they want to keep that part of him.  The problem is that even in his current form, Taric is very serious.  If you read his lines, and consider the way he says them, it is apparent that he is very serious.  It is the player perception of Taric that makes him, and many of his lines, silly.   That, I feel, is the core of Taric's personality.  He is a very serious, compassionate and protective person at his core.  And yet there is some part of what he says and how he says that is PERCEIVED in the mind of the player as being slightly off and/or silly.  Taric shouldn't just become Riot's gay joke (as he is often used now).  He should live up to his lore and by the protector/healer that it says he is but at the same time keep a degree of his perceived "outrageousness."

P.S.  Love the concept art.
